fields.description:
The com.atlassian.crowd.integration.service.cache.CachingUserManager from the crowd-integration-client-soap:2.2.0 module is still not thread-safe. This is basically due to the Crowd team having abandoned ([CWD-2041|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2041?focusedCommentId=207804&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-207804], [CWD-2181|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2181?focusedCommentId=225819&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-225819]) this approach completely.

Alex improved the code in [AOD-3547|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-3547] which at least fixed the failing AGMP tests from [AOD-2922|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-2922]. 

We should investigate how we can use the DB-based caching facilities introduced for embedded crowd for JIRA 4.3.
fields.summary: Reuse DB-based caching facilities for Crowd in JIRA 4.3

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce

# Create two projects, FOO and BAR.
# Associate the Fisheye repository BAR with project FOO, leave the primary repository as FOO.
# Disassociate the Fisheye repository BAR from project BAR.
# Make a commit to repository BAR referencing an issue in project FOO.
# View the issue that was referenced in the commit, see that the commit made to repository BAR shows in the Source tab.
# Restart JIRA.
# Refresh that same issue in FOO, there's now no mention of the commit that was in project BAR above, and in the JIRA Fisheye Plugin config page, there is no mention of BAR anywhere. In the project admin page, repository BAR is still showing as a secondary repository for project FOO.

Step 3 is important, if repository BAR isn't disassociated from project BAR, everything works fine after the restart.

An alternative way to get into this situation if if there's been repositories created by Support (upon customer request) solely within Fisheye, that don't have projects associated with them.

Fortunately this is fixable by customers, they'd need to log in with an administrator account, go to the project admin page, then unassociate and reassociate the repositories ("FishEye Repository", click the "Select" link).
fields.summary: Secondary Fisheye repositories associated with JIRA projects become unassociated after a JIRA restart
User Oauth tokens page contains some escaped tags in the output

fields.description:
The current implementation of the FishEye filter still require that the Remember Me cookie have the encrypted credentials for the user, what is no longer true as that pose a major security vulnerability.
The filter should rely on the JIRA Remember Me funcionality.
If the user logged in using the Remember Me feature, closes its browser and comes back directly to a FECRU URL it will be presented with the FECRU login page instead of automatically logging in and showing the actual URL content.
fields.summary: Remember Me filter not working for FishEye/Crucible

fields.description: Jira QuickSearch will find issues even when searching for an ID that was used prior to moving the issue to a new project.  This ability seems to be missing in StudioSearch.  A workaround is to use the OpenSearch plugin and search for the old ID from the browser's search box, since OpenSearch uses QuickSearch.jspa instead of StudioSearch.jspa.  The ability to find things by the old ID is pervasive throughout the application; for instance, old ID's are resolved successfully in auto-links created by Jira and Confluence. Additionally, stand-alone JIRA supports QuickSearch by an old id, so not having it in Studio QuickSearch seems like a glaring omission.
fields.summary: Studio Quicksearch (StudioSearch.jspa) does not find moved issue id's
When opening the account page it results in an error

fields.description:
Labels are created case sensitive (which I like), so it is possible to create two identical labels with different casing (not so much).
This means that e.g. during type-ahead I need to start typing the label in the exact same case as it was created in, otherwise I don't get suggestions.

I would very much like to see that:
-> Labels are stored in a case-sensitive way the first time a particular label is created.
-> Duplicate labels with different casing are avoided.
-> Typeahead (or other searches) work in a case-insensitive way.
fields.summary: JIRA Labels - make labels/type ahead case insensitive

fields.description:
In standalone JIRA from version 4.2 onwards, when importing XML from an older version, if the index and attachment paths that are specified in the XML don't exist the importer will offer to reset them to the default paths ({{$JIRA_HOME/caches/}} and {{$JIRA_HOME/data/attachments/}}, respectively). When importing a customer's standalone data into Studio, however, it just stops (_after_ the potentially very lengthy parsing process) with an error:

{quote}
*Error*

The index path <old path> specified in the backup file is not valid.
The attachment path <old path> specified in the backup file is not valid.
path not found
{quote}

And there's no option to just continue on with the default paths. It really should just reset to the default paths and proceed with the import process.
fields.summary: Studio JIRA Importer doesn't give "Reset to default paths" option when importing from older standalone versions

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Create an issue with a long description or several comments --- enough to force a vertical scroll bar onto the page.
# Scroll part way down the page to engage the "stalker" behaviour of the top tool bar
# Click the comment button in the tool bar to open a comment form at the top of the page
# Click the security level drop down (lock icon)

Results:

# The browser will scroll back to the top of the page
# The drop down menu will stay put further down the page (scroll down to see it)

If you play around with other combinations of the top & bottom comment buttons, and scroll around, you can see a variety of other strange behaviour as well. For example, click the top Comment button when scrolled all the way to the top of the page, then open the security level drop down, then scroll down the page. The menu will move up off the top of the page.
fields.summary: Glitchy behaviour in the issue comment security level drop down

fields.description:
Any transition which is not a standard system transition can't be executed using the commit commands. This stack trace shows up in the logs.

It seems to be caused by issueManager.getIssueObject(issueKey) (CommitCommentServiceImpl.java:75) retrieving an issue object which has not issue type set (but does have a type id set). It's weird because the code path seems the same for system transitions, but it doesn't break with them.

We should investigate using the \*Service classes provided by JIRA instead of the \*Manager classes, as services are designed for external use and managers aren't.

I am not sure whether this was caused by the JIRA upgrade or not.

A functional test in Studio should be written.

fields.description:
After the upgrade to 2.4 the user is unable to use the Remember Me feature to auto-login on anything but JIRA.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open one browser session and go to http://dev.jira.com, login with the Remember Me checkbox checked.
2. Close the browser.
3. Open another browser session and go to http://dev.jira.com/wiki I will be asked to type the credentials again, where the Remember Me cookie should have logged the user in.
fields.summary: Remember Me feature not working for Wiki, Source, Reviews, Builds

fields.description:
We currently recommend [disabling|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=224397803] users instead of deleting them for JIRA Studio. This approach works, but is regarded by most customer as a workaround due to their large user bases or long-running systems.

All the user management functionality we expose to customers is steered over JIRA. Thus you can't [delete|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA042/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-DeletingaUser] a user who is still *referenced on issues either as an assignee or reporter*, as you already found out. Confluence doesn't [allow|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/How+do+I+Remove+a+User+who+has+Content+Created] the deletion of users who already created content. Since this is validation performed in the controllers of Confluence, and we steer the user management over JIRA, that is still possible. The result of this will be e.g. a deleted user still being reported as the creator of a page. If you click on the profile link you will get a "Page Not Found" error page. Fisheye allows the [deletion|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE022/Deleting+or+deactivating+a+User] of users, Bamboo [restricts|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO026/Deleting+or+deactivating+a+User] it to users not having commented to build results.

We could provide a more convenient delete functionality for JIRA which does the necessary permission checking in advance and aggregates the transitioning and reassigning step. We could provide a similar functionality for Confluence and Bamboo and aggregate that under one view.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I'd like to have a low-effort user deletion functionality

fields.description:
Collaborators are not able to access builds in the first place, however they can still hit the builds url.  When they do, they get stuck in a login loop:

- bamboo kicks them to the bamboo login screen
- since they are already logged in, the browser tries to take them back to /builds
- loop

This needs a proper error page and/or a smarter redirect.
fields.summary: Login loops when Collaborators try to access Bamboo

fields.description:
When FishEye starts up it can sometimes do so without critical plugins. They appear to timeout. This has been seed on initial start-up after an upgrade where all apps are starting at the same time, so the system would be under a high load.

A symptom of this is that projects cannot be created. An error such as:
{quote}FishEye: Creation of FishEye repository 'MYPROJECT' failed.{quote}
will be produced.

Another symptom is this error is shown when one visits "Source" admin page:
bq. The SVN repository auth file can not be read. Please contact a system administrator.

I am attaching logs of a FishEye instance that started up without the plugins and then was restarted to correct the problem.
fields.summary: FishEye sometimes starts up without critical plugins

fields.description:
JIRA: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-3192
Confluence: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-3357
FishEye: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-3906
fields.summary: Investigate issues causing plugin timeouts in JIRA, Confluence and FishEye

fields.description:
A number of customers have not had their attachments or index directories moved to the default location, even though JIRA's configuration was changed to look for them there.

This resulted in the inability to access attachments and it seeming like there were no issues in the system (due to the missing index).
fields.summary: JIRA attachments and index directories not moved over as part of the 2.4 upgrade
Individual project activity stream giving "Internal server error"

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
1) Go to any JIRA issue.
2) Type in the key for any other JIRA issue (or anything else, for that matter).
3) Select one of the auto-type search results.

*Expected Behavior*
You are taken to the requested page without warning.

*Actual Behavior*
You are warned about navigating away from the page, as if you made changes you did not save.
fields.summary: "Navigate away from page" warning when selecting quick-search result
Exceptions in Gliffy

fields.description:
JIRA doesn't provide a web-based configuration for this (due to the security implications I guess), but it provides a documentation on how to change the relevant Velocity template (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA042/Setting+a+Default+Value+in+the+Description+Field).
This feature has been requested for hosted in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-15725 .
fields.summary: I would like to customise the default value for the description field in JIRA

fields.description:
In reality, a customer could purchase 0 collaborator accounts.

Bug is in: LicenseCheckResult:line 21
fields.summary: LicenseCheckResult wrongly throws an IllegalArgumentException when licenseLimit is 0

fields.description:
This means that whenever someone logs in from another app (e.g. confluence) they are redirected to a double-escaped URL and it 404s.

Using Remember Me mitigates the problem as it decreases the frequency of login.
fields.summary: login redirect double encodes the target URL

fields.description:
JIRA Wallboar plugin is not working in Studio. The steps to use it would be:

To create a GreenHopper wallboard, you must be signed in as the project lead.
# Click the 'Agile' menu in the top navigation bar and select 'Planning Board' from the drop-down menu.
# Select your project from the project dropdown, if it is not already selected.
# Select the 'Project Overview' viewing mode from the drop-down menu under the Project name.
# Hover over Project box on the right hand side and click on the 'cog' icon that appears to display a drop-down menu.
# Select 'Create Wallboard'.
# A Wallboard will be created with the name '<Project name> (autogenerated)' and displayed. Your Wallboard will contain:
** the Hour Burndown Chart gadget
** the Days Remaining gadget
** the Project Progress gadget

*However, the wallboard option does not appear in the drop-down menu mentioned in step 5.*

JIRA Wallboard plugin is now Bundled with Studio: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy#JIRAStudioPluginPolicy-Issues%28JIRA%29

Wallboard plugin docs says it's compatible with GreenHopper 5.2.4+
{quote}
If you are using GreenHopper 5.2.4 or later you can quickly create a Wallboard including an hour burndown chart, days remaining notification and project progress bar.
{quote}
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/WALLBOARD/Wallboards+101

We're currently using 5.4.1 in Studio: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Application+Versions#JIRAStudioApplicationVersions-GreenHopper

Plugin's page says it's compatible with JIRA 4.2.4: https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/23983

We're currently using JIRA 4.2.2: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Application+Versions#JIRAStudioApplicationVersions-Issues%28JIRA%29

Support JIRA Wallboard: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23540

fields.description:
The following configuration needs to be created during installation / conversion. For the spike I hacked the {{install_studio.sh}} script to create {{/data/jirastudio/home/studio.properties}}:

{code}
# GAPPS Related configuration
com.atlassian.agmp.domain.name=atl-paid-dev.com
com.atlassian.agmp.admin.email=gapps-syd@atlassian.com
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.consumer.key=<signer key goes here>
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.signer.url=http://signer/cgi-bin/signer/signer.pl
com.atlassian.agmp.google.logout.url=http://www.google.com/a/atl-paid-dev.com/Logout
com.atlassian.agmp.reprovision=1

# no more than 50 concurrent requests:
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.signer.max.connections=50
# 10 second timeout:
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.signer.http.timeout.millis=10000
{code}

Perhaps the unicorn scripts could be modified to create a file called {{gapps.properties}} in {{/data/jirastudio/home}} with these properties, and the Gapps properties class modified to read from that location.
fields.summary: modify the properties scripts on unicorn to include gapps info

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

fields.description:
We often times run into situations when subversion is being abused by external systems, whether it be external CI systems, or bamboo agents talking to /builds. This in its best case causes slowdowns, and potential usability of subversion. In it's worst case, the symptom has been known to bring down entire systems. These problems, while definitely exceptions, rather than rules, usually manifest in support, with little and sometimes no controllable means of solution.

Some sort of Subversion QoS should be implemented.
fields.summary: Add Subversion QoS
Upgrade Subversion to a version that doesn't hit 'database is locked' errors

fields.description:
I'm using following JQL query in the filter for tracking tasks which were resolved  by developers and not yet verified by QA/QC team:
"project = DD AND assignee = currentUser() AND status = Resolved AND NOT labels = regressiontesting AND NOT labels = blocked AND NOT labels = live-regressiontesting ORDER BY priority DESC"

You can see there numerous "AND NOT" conditions which allow me to separate tasks which are to be verified on instance #1/verified on instance #2 and so on.

Filter with above listed parameters doesn't return any issues though must return ones without "regressiontesting", "blocked' and "live-regressiontesting" labels.

Previously this filter has worked fine.

We faced this problem when our JIRA was updated on February, 14th
fields.summary: Filter with numerous "AND NOT" conditions for labes doesn't work properly

fields.description:
This bug appeared on 14.2.2010, after the update on 13.2.2010.

Go to Task Board, select version X and developer D.
Change the version of a task to version Y.
The filter changes to version Y and no developer is selected (filter to All Assignees).

Was working fine until at least 11.2.2010, where the behaviour was that the flter stayed in place an a little message said something that "you can't view the message you were working on because it is not in the filter".

The current behavior is really annoying because you have to get back to the version you were working on.
Using the planning board is not an option because you cannot filter on the developer.
fields.summary: Task Board - changing version number changes filter

Are you sure you want to navigate away from this page?

You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost.

Press OK to continue, or Cancel to stay on the current page.

{quote}

This can be annoying especially when it involves frequent assigns. Also, all browser tabs will freeze until the warning is dismissed.

*Note*: This problem does not exist in standalone JIRA 4.2.2.

fields.description:
We upgrade JIRA to 4.3 and FeCru 2.5 for Studio 2.5. Both products will bundle the UPM. The UPM Permission Service created for AOD-3113 should be moved out of studio-theme-confluence-plugin in order to be reusable. It shouldn't reside in studio-common-components-plugin since Bamboo doesn't provide the UPM yet, imo it would be better to have a separate bundle for it.

The logic for the service resides in com.atlassian.studio.confluence.upm, and is glued together by two Spring context definitions called upm-permission-service-prod.xml and upm-permission-service-unit.xml. The Confluence home discovery (upm-permission-service-prod.xml) and configuration of user-installed plugins (user-installed-plugins.properties) have to stay external to that common plugin. 

This could be either achieved by attaching a fragment bundle or consuming the com.atlassian.studio.confluence.upm.PermissionFilter from the OSGi container and split the configuration into another bundle of common filters and product-specific filters (which could remain in the studio-theme-<product>-plugin).
fields.summary: Move UPM Permission Service into separate bundle

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Please bundle Salesforce Connector from CustomWare in Confluence.

https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/241

This is different from the JIRA connector covered by AOD-3598.
fields.summary: Bundle the CustomWare Connector for Salesforce and Confluence

fields.description:
Picked up by Alex. See: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-374#c31169

The init.properties file on Unicorn currently supplies a http://<hostname>/svn url that fisheye uses to index SVN.

For performance reasons, this should be a file:// url, and we should ask Chris Geers/Hosted Platform team to change the cgi script that generates the init.properties file.

In the longer run however, this poses an interesting question if different studio apps are no longer all on the same machine and don't have local storage.
fields.summary: Fisheye picks up http:// url for SVN rather than file:// on Unicorn
